newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-REFEREE DANSON ADMITS HIS MISTAKE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-REFEREE DANSON ADMITS HIS MISTAKE.

text.p: Referee Paul Danson has admitted he was wrong to send off Sunderland's Paul Stewart against Arsenal at Highbury last week and the striker will now escape a one match suspension.

Danson, who had already sent off Sunderland defender Martin Scott for two bookable fouls in the same game, agreed to review the evidence of Stewart's dismissal at a weekend referees seminar with the Football Association and the League Managers' Association.
Stewart, who had already been booked for hand ball, repeated the offence, but claimed he was fouled in doing so by Arsenal's Steve Bould.
Now Danson has told the FA: "It was a genuine mininterpretation on my part."

Sunderland, whose manager Peter Reid was also dismissed in the same 2-0 defeat by Arsenal for arguing with Danson about Scott's dismissal, has already been charged by the FA with bringing the game into disrepute.
